alert.note: Alert for Grant; Roberts (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 16 at 8:52AM MDT until further notice by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in South Dakota...Minnesota... Minnesota River near Big Stone Lake affecting Big Stone, Roberts and Grant Counties. Minnesota River at Ortonville affecting Big Stone County. 12 Mile Creek near Wheaton affecting Traverse County. 5 Mile Creek Near Herman affecting Traverse County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and increase river flows. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Minnesota River Big Stone Lake. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 973.0 feet, 40 TO 60 structures inundated, including homes on the Ortonville peninsula. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:30 AM CDT Sunday the stage was 972.7 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM CDT Sunday was 972.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 972.9 feet this afternoon. - Flood stage is 971.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abr. The next statement will be issued Monday evening by 600 PM CDT.
